Bear With One Another.--We must bear with one another, remembering our failings. With some have compassion, making a difference; others save with fear, pulling 


                                                      633 

them out of the fire. All cannot bear the same rigid discipline. All cannot be brought up to just another's ideas of duty. Allowance must be made for different temperaments and different minds. God knows how to deal with us. But my heart has been sick as I have seen brother deal with brother and the disposition to catch another in his words and to make a man an offender for a word. . . .
